SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jawin
Class FuncPtr

java.lang.Object
  org.jawin.FuncPtr
public final class FuncPtr
extends java.lang.Object

Class for working with a reference to a single Win32 function exposed in standard DLL's. The Jawin Userguide - Calling a DLL Entry Point document should be consulted about how to use this class.

Contains several invoke_*-methods for some standard function signatures. These falls in three groups:

  • invoke_I-methods for native methods with a standard int as [retval]
  • invoke_OI-methods for native methods with a last parameter being a [out] int
  • invoke_S-methods for native methods returning a byte array (can be used for methods returning structs)
Please notice that because of the TYPEDEF in C/C++ many method signatures are covered by the relatively few invoke_*-methods, as eg. HWND, HRESULT, LONG etc. all can be represented as Java int's.

If working with a function that does not match one of the standard signatures, use the generic invoke(String, int, NakedByteStream, Object[], ReturnFlags).

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
Stuart Halloway, http://www.relevancellc.com/halloway/weblog/
Morten Andersen, arosii_moa (at) users.sourceforge.net
See Also:
The Jawin Userguide - Calling a DLL Entry Point

Constructor Detail

FuncPtr

public FuncPtr(java.lang.String dll,
               java.lang.String name)
        throws COMException
Parameters:
dll - the name of a DLL (can be either just the name of the DLL or a full path - use backslashes (\)). Note, that the name is not case sensitive and that the ".dll"-part is optional. The exact syntax for the parameter can be found in the MSDN documentation for LoadLibrary.
name - the function name exposed in the DLL.
Throws:
COMException - if unable to load the DLL or find the function.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either dll or name is null.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

close

public void close()
           throws COMException
Call to "free" the function pointer. Windows automatically manages a reference count for each library and will close the library if this was the last active function.

After close() has been called the FuncPtr should not be used anymore as all invoke's will throw an IllegalStateException.

Throws:
COMException

finalize

protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
backup for releasing resources, by calling close().

Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

invoke

public byte[] invoke(java.lang.String instructions,
                     int stackSize,
                     int argStreamSize,
                     byte[] argStream,
                     java.lang.Object[] objectArgs,
                     ReturnFlags flags)
              throws COMException
generic method for calling native methods that do not match any of the invoke_* methods. If the caller is using a NakedByteStream for building the stack-bytes, the invoke(String, int, NakedByteStream, Object[], ReturnFlags) shortcut method is prefered.

Parameters:
instructions - the marshalling instructions for marshalling both the stack-array onto the native stack (this is the [in]-parameters) and marshalling the [return] and [out]-parameters onto the returned byte array. Is on the form xx:y:zz, where xx is for the [in]-marshalling, y is for the [return]-marshalling, and zz is for any [out]-marshalling if present. See the Jawin documentation for more about the instruction-strings.
stackSize - the size of the call stack on the native side that the content of the argStream-array should be marshalled to.
argStreamSize - the number of relevant bytes in the argStream-array (often a NakedByteStream is used for the argStream-array, in which case the array will not be full.
argStream - the bytes that should be marshalled to the stack on the native side. The length of this array can NOT be smaller than argStreamSize.
objectArgs - [in/out] used if any java-object should be passed back and forth into the native code.
flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the [return] and [out] parameters from the native call, serialized following the marshalling-instructions given the second and third part of the instructions string.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if argStreamSize is bigger than the length of the argStream-array.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

invoke

public byte[] invoke(java.lang.String instructions,
                     int stackSize,
                     NakedByteStream argStream,
                     java.lang.Object[] objectArgs,
                     ReturnFlags flags)
              throws COMException
shortcut method for calling invoke(String, int, int, byte[], Object[], ReturnFlags) when using a NakedByteStream for building the argStream-bytes.

Parameters:
argStream - the NakedByteStream containing the argStream-bytes. Null is equal to an empty argStream.
Throws:
COMException
See Also:
invoke(String, int, int, byte[], Object[], ReturnFlags)

invoke_I

public int invoke_I(ReturnFlags flags)
             throws COMException
for calling native methods taking no args, and returning an int.

Parameters:
flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the result of the native method.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the result of the native method.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

invoke_I

public int invoke_I(byte[] arg0,
                    ReturnFlags flags)
             throws COMException
for calling native methods taking one pointer to a byte array, and returning an int. Can for example be used for methods taking a pointer to a struct, like DispatchMessageW.

Parameters:
arg0 - the arg that should be passed to the native method as a pointer to a byte array.
flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the result of the native method.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

invoke_OI

public int invoke_OI(int arg0,
                     ReturnFlags flags)
              throws COMException
for calling native methods taking two int args, where the last int is a [out] parameter. This [out] parameter will be returned by this function. An example of such a function is GetNumberOfEventLogRecords().

Parameters:
arg0 - the [in] int argument.
flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the result of the native method.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

                     ReturnFlags flags)
              throws COMException
for calling native methods taking five int args, where the first four are standard [in] parameters and the last int is a [out] parameter.

Throws:
COMException

                     java.lang.String arg1,
                     ReturnFlags flags)
              throws COMException

COMException

invoke_OI(int, ReturnFlags)

invoke_S

public byte[] invoke_S(int arg0,
                       int returnSize,
                       ReturnFlags flags)
                throws COMException
for calling native methods taking one int arg, and returning a byte array of a specified size (typically used when calling methods returning a struct with a known byte-size).

Parameters:
arg0 - the [in] int argument.
returnSize - the size of the byte array to return.
flags - used for specifying the native error handling, can not be null.
Returns:
the result of the native method - will be a byte array with size returnSize.
Throws:
COMException - if the native method failed.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if flags is null.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this FuncPtr has been closed.

invoke_S

public byte[] invoke_S(byte[] arg0,
                       int returnSize,
                       ReturnFlags flags)
                throws COMException
for calling native methods taking one pointer to a byte array, and returning a byte array of a specified size.

Throws:
COMException
See Also:
invoke_S(int, int, ReturnFlags)

                       int arg1,
                       int returnSize,
                       ReturnFlags flags)
                throws COMException
